name: Bohemian Hotel Celebration, Autograph Collection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last month my husband surprised me with a night stay at the Bohemian Hotel in Celebration, FL. We had an amazing time and the staff took care of our every need. When we checked in we had a suite. When we got to the room it was wonderful. There was a card wishing me a happy birthday on the able signed by the staff. That was so thoughtful of them to do that. We walked around downtown Celebration and did some shopping. It was such a quiet and quaint area. In the morning we walked around the trails and it was so peaceful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Birthday Celebration at Bohemian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel, good sized double rooms, very clean and really friendly. What makes the hotel even better is its location. Celebration is a brilliant little town and everything is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Great restaurants, bars and a Starbucks are all on your door step. It is minutes from I4 and the Orlando's attractions are all less than 10 minutes away. Parking at the hotel is not free but we parked on the street which has no charge and a space was easy to find. We had an excellent stay and I would really recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in the great town of Celebration

reviews.text: I recently stayed the the Bohemian Hotel in Celebration, Florida and what a great experience. From making my reservation to check in through the entire stay the Hotel's staff was the best. The hotel rooms are beautiful, I had a view of the lake which was spectacular. You can walk to everything in this quaint town form the Hotel. The food is outstanding the the Happy Hour was fun and entertaining. I will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Gem of a Hotel in Celebration

reviews.text: The title really sums it up. The hotel is very nice. Smartly decorated with great outdoor space. The restaurant has a great breakfast and brunch. The location is fine, with a Starbucks and fantastic selection of restaurants I'm walking distance. Not very convenient to tourist attractions. They have shuttles that are expensive and run at strange times. My room was charming although a little small. The main reason I would not stay here again is the terrible odor coming off the lake. It was a swampy, mildew smell the permeated the entire hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Strange Odor

reviews.text: I visited Orlando for a small work conference. I stayed at the Bohemian instead of the conference hotel and was not disappointed. The Celebration area is an amazing little niche of Orlando away from the craziness of the city. The hotel itself was spectacular. The room was clean and comfortable, the bar was very nice (although I only ordered some appetizers, never got a chance to sit and drink), there's a beautiful walking path behind the hotel. I just wish I'd had more time in Orlando to stay and enjoy myself at this hotel.
reviews.title: Wish I could've stayed longer!

reviews.text: What a sweet hotel! From the minute you are greeted at the door by Ron and his colleagues, you are made to feel at home. We had a lake view room and it was amazing to look back at Celebration with the twinkling lights at night, and the mist rising at sunrise - well worth the upgrade. We stayed last March and were there for St Patricks day - Celebration certainly lived up to its name! The craic was brilliant! We didn't want to drive, and so the hotel organised transport to the themeparks - Disney is only a few minutes drive, but the fare of c $25 is expensive as it includes the $14 vehicle charge that Disney load on all cars. There's a great range of restaurants in Celebration, as well as a selection of lively bars. We ate in the Thai a couple of time - highly recommended. We had one meal in the hotel on the night we arrived, and it was lovely albeit expensive. The town is built around a lake, with rocking chairs here and there in order to sit and watch the world go by. The locals are some of the friendliest I have ever met in the US - and that's saying a lot given Americans in general are so warm and welcoming ! I think Celebration is more for adults - perhaps children would miss the hustle and bustle of the resort hotels? Would we go back? Already booked and arriving next St Patricks Day! And I can't wait!
reviews.title: alternative orlando

reviews.text: We arrived here without a booking and were really happy.
reviews.title: Nice start to a holiday.

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and were impressed. The service throughout was great. Attentive and polite.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ignore the reviews that say parking is a joke. If you don't want to pay for valet, the street parking RIGHT IN FRONT of the hotel is free. It's only 20ft away from the valet station.
reviews.title: Toy Town Excellence

reviews.text: There is a nice pool that is in a good spot for the sun and a view of the lake. We had a 3rd floor room with a mixed lake and town view. Comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Nice but needs better management.

reviews.text: From my reservation call, through checking out, I was very well treated, especially by Valerie. Great assistance with ground transportation, as well as directions in the area. The lobby area has an elegant, yet comfortable lay out with good places for networking/visits. The rooms were very clean and had everything I needed. The TV was older, and the electrical plugs around the desk and bedside table weren't super convenient. Nevertheless, the bed was very comfortable, the room smelled fresh, and everything worked just fine. I had breakfast room service...eggs benedict, yum. I really enjoyed the art work displayed throughout the lower level. Great location within Celebration. I was there for a meeting, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Valerie was fantastic

reviews.text: I visited this hotel for my husbands 40th birthday and couldn't have made a better choice. The staff are fab. Valerie at the hotel pre booked a restaurant for us and even called on the night to check all was ok! The location is amazing beautiful settings and full sun at the pool. My son just loved it the staff treated him like family! The hotel has been fully refurbished so the rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable. The food in the hotel is great however local pubs' wine bars and restaurants in the gorgeous town of celebration are a few footsteps away so no need to constantly rely on the car. You will not regret staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous in every way!

reviews.text: Decided to spend some Marriott points for my boyfriends birthday weekend. We walked in and were told the room wasn't ready so we decided to sit at the lobby bar for a bit and I observed every other customer getting greeted by all of the staff but for some reason we never got a welcome like this when we came in the door or walked around (the bartender was very friendly though). Maybe you need to look like you have a ton of money for them to acknowledge you? Anyway, the property was very busy and we waited until after 4:00 to get a room. The hallways near our room smelled musty and it looked like someone dragged a potted plant down the hallway after dipping it in bleach - there were bleached circles all over. The room was ok, nothing spectacular and the bed was the old style box, firm mattress nothing like the new fluff you get elsewhere and they have the old tube TV's still.
reviews.title: Beautiful location and lobby - so-so rooms.

reviews.text: I loved the look of the lobby area and dining area outdoors, just wished it translated through the rest of the experience in the rooms. If you are looking to stay within the Celebration area, this is a great location but I am not sure its worth the points I spent or the money they are asking for per night.
reviews.title: This hotel makes us feel part of the family

reviews.text: I have stayed in celebration hotel for the last 3 yrs and each time we come home with fond memories and new friends. The hotel is fantastic with great amenities and has an elegance about it. The staff are tremendous from all the bar staff, conceirge to managers . In particular I need to mention Valerie who looks after me and my family and it's feels like we have known her for years. She is a true asset to the hotel who should be so proud to have her in the team. My son really feels at home when we visit and all the staff look after him. We cannot wait to return ...
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I decided to take a weekend getaway to Celebration. I eat in town often and have always wanted to stay at the hotel. We found a terrific rate and decided to check it out.
reviews.title: Quiet and Classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the other reviews, I really wanted a balcony room with the rocking chairs. Balconies are not guaranteed but the request was noted. Our focus for this stay was to relax. We wanted a quiet stay in a nice area with good food.
reviews.title: A really lovely place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked away from the hotel. We didn't want to pay $15.00 to park. The area is extremely safe. There is open parking across the street and all over the town. We parked in front of the condos after asking locals if it was ok. Everyone said park anywhere that isn't marked for residents only. It was less than a minutes’ walk to the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient and Relaxing--Great restaurant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is quiet. Wonderfully quiet. We did not hear one other guest or cleaning person. We slept in both days until 10:00am and even took a mid-day nap. No noise. The hotel put families with children together in another hallway. I don't know if this was accident or planned, but what a wonderful concept if it was intentional.
reviews.title: What can I say!!!

reviews.text: Prior to arrival I made reservations for a Segway tour through the Virtual Concierge named Valerie. She was terrific. She set up the tour and was very patient when I couldn't decide on what room type I wanted. She even sent me an email telling me that she would be off on the day I arrived and she left me her cell number in case I needed anything. Who does that? It was a great feeling.
reviews.title: Fantastic! Can't wait to go back.

description: At this hotel you get to experience small town America.
